lexUnit.name: earring.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of jewellery worn on the lobe or edge of the ear.

sentence.text: ` If you 've got some jet , " said Scarlet , ` you could make my mother a necklace and earrings for Christmas .
On each occasion I took at least half an hour to get ready , chose my clothes carefully , brushed my teeth , put my earrings in , wore bright-red lipstick .

Just then the teacher emerged from the school , her large earrings glinting like thin bangles .
This had annoyed Jonquil and set her steel earring swinging with temper .

She wore jeans and a large jumper , cowboy boots , one stainless steel earring .
He was wearing diamond stud earrings and high-rococo filigree-and-rivet cowboy boots .
You can also buy matching necklaces and earrings at bargain prices .
On her last visit I 'd been unable to take my eyes off her gold earrings and her bangles .
I put on some gold dangly earrings I 'd found in the bottom of my bag and came out feeling a new woman .
The dealers wear silver and gold medallions , rings , earrings , fashionable shorts and trainers .
